intro: Psychotria nimbana f. vallicola, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. Due to its unique appearance and potential ethnobotanical significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
